required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: OH2 Oncolytic Viral Therapy in Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase Ib/II Study of OH2 Injection, an Oncolytic Type 2 Herpes Simplex Virus Expressing Granulocyte Macrophage Colony-Stimulating Factor, in Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
This phase Ib/II study evaluates the safety and efficacy of OH2 in patients with locally advanced/metastatic pancreatic cancer who have failed first-line standard treatment.
OH2 is an oncolytic virus developed upon genetic modifications of the herpes simplex virus type 2 strain HG52, allowing the virus to selectively replicate in tumors. Meanwhile, the delivery of the gene encoding human granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF) may induce a more potent antitumor immune response.

detailed_description.textblock: OH2 injection ≤ 4 mL, administered by intratumoral injection of EUS-FNA, administered on the first day of the first cycle, every 3 weeks thereafter, administered on the 1st day of each cycle ± 3 days, continuous administration does not more than 6 treatment cycles.

primary_outcome.measure: The objective response rate of patients with pancreatic cancer receiving OH2 injection.
primary_outcome.description: Tumor evaluation is performed according to RECIST1.1 and iRECIST1.1. The assessment result is the number and proportion of subjects with complete response + partial response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of safety of OH2 injection in patients with pancreatic cancer.
secondary_outcome.description: According to the version 5.0 of the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, the adverse events during the entire study period are evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: The disease control rate of patients with pancreatic cancer receiving OH2 injection.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor evaluation is performed according to RECIST1.1 and iRECIST1.1. The assessment result is the number and proportion of subjects with complete response + partial response + stable disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: The duration of response of patients with pancreatic cancer receiving OH2 injection
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor evaluation is performed according to RECIST1.1 and iRECIST1.1. The time from the first assessment of complete response or partial response to the first assessment of disease progression or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: The progression free survival of patients with pancreatic cancer receiving OH2 injection.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor evaluation is performed according to RECIST1.1 and iRECIST1.1. Time from start of treatment to disease progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the impact of OH2 in patients with pancreatic cancer on the quality of life

arm_group.description: OH2 injection will be administered at 1E+07 CCID50/mL .
